intro: Acroceras macrum, commonly known as the purple-fruited bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its fruit is a dry capsule that splits open to release small, rounded seeds. Acroceras macrum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
